Class BlackJackPlayer

java.lang.Object
  BlackJackPlayer

public class BlackJackPlayer
extends java.lang.Object

Given a player's cards and the dealer's up card, this class finds the desired move for a blackjack player based on the strategy given in a file (typically the optimal strategy).

Constructor Summary
BlackJackPlayer(java.lang.String fileName)
          Reads the strategy in from a file.
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String getMove(BlackJackHand player, int upCard)
          Extracts the desired move (excluding splits) from the strategy array for hard and soft hands.
 java.lang.String getSplit(BlackJackHand player, int upCard)
          Determines if a split is the desired move if the first two cards in a hand have the same value.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

BlackJackPlayer

public BlackJackPlayer(java.lang.String fileName)
Reads the strategy in from a file.

Method Detail

getMove

public java.lang.String getMove(BlackJackHand player,
                                int upCard)
Extracts the desired move (excluding splits) from the strategy array for hard and soft hands. Use the hand value to make it easier to identify the necessary row from the strategy array. Returns a "S" if the correct play is to stand. Returns an "H" if the correct play is to hit. Returns a "D" if the correct play is to double. Note: the BlackJack game will interpret a "D" as an "H" if the hand cannot be doubled.

getSplit

public java.lang.String getSplit(BlackJackHand player,
                                 int upCard)
Determines if a split is the desired move if the first two cards in a hand have the same value. Use the (modified) hand value to make it easier to identify the necessary row from the strategy array. Returns an "N" if a split is not the correct play, or "Y" if a split is the correct play according to the strategy.
